item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (304 points | 104 comments)
2. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (232 points | 83 comments)
3. Entire Independent Board of Directors of 23andMe Resigns (84 points | 27 comments)
4. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (182 points | 83 comments)
5. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (135 points | 21 comments)
6. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
7. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (79 points | 49 comments)
8. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (286 points | 24 comments)
9. Ribbit: A portable, compact and extensible R4RS Scheme implementation (17 points | 5 comments)
10. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (123 points | 111 comments)
11. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (144 points | 47 comments)
12. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (100 points | 8 comments)
13. Show HN: Will I run Boston 2025? (32 points | 28 comments)
14. Swift 6 (303 points | 168 comments)
15. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (57 points | 34 comments)
16. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (90 points | 63 comments)
17. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (582 points | 1401 comments)
18. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (203 points | 46 comments)
19. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (104 points | 11 comments)
20. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (204 points | 119 comments)
21. Scrolling Text Display (3 points | discuss)
22. Reports of the Death of Dental Cavities Are Greatly Exaggerated (13 points | 5 comments)
23. A Word about Systemd (20 points | 36 comments)
24. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (28 points | 1 comment)
25. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (97 points | 58 comments)
26. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (93 points | 29 comments)
27. Krazam: High Agency Individual Contributor [video] (154 points | 32 comments)
28. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (99 points | 53 comments)
29. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (68 points | 13 comments)
30. Quote Origin: I had exactly four seconds and Google had told me it wasn’t enough (245 points | 107 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
